CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON are brothers . They are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are heirs of the owner of CARDINAL plots of land and buildings , which constituted a property called “ ORG ” . The property was de facto expropriated by the ORG by virtue of the DATE ORG in DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP However , in this particular case the relevant authorities failed to issue an appropriate administrative decision , declaring that the property had been subject to expropriation within the framework of the agrarian reform .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG ownership title was entered in the land and mortgage register .

CARDINAL . In respect of plot no . DATE , the right of perpetual use of that plot was granted by ORG to the “ PERSON - Kieleckiego SA ” and that company was designated as the present occupier . On DATE the ORG - owned enterprise was transformed into an independent public company , the “ PERSON - Kieleckiego SA ” , the structure and functioning of which were governed by the provisions of LAW and other relevant Acts . The ORG however retained a PERCENT shareholding in the company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the GPE Governor to issue a decision stating that the property “ FAC Kolonie Fabryczne ” should not have been subject to expropriation under section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( e ) of the DATE ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the FAC Governor partly dismissed the applicants’ request , finding that a part of the property had met the criteria for expropriation set out in the CARDINAL Decree . However , the Governor declared that several plots of land with an overall area of CARDINAL hectares should not have been subject to expropriation . This decision concerned , among others , plot no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The applicants and the present occupier of CARDINAL of the plots appealed . On DATE the ORG opponent withdrew its appeal . On DATE the Minister of Agriculture discontinued the appellate proceedings in respect of the part of the decision given in the applicants’ favour and dismissed the ORG appeal against the remainder of the decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG further appeal , finding that the contested administrative decisions of the GPE Governor and the Minister of Agriculture had been lawful .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings for rectification of an entry in the land and mortgage register . They requested the court to enter their title to plot no . CARDINAL in the land and mortgage register . Hearings were held on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision , securing the applicants’ claims by entering a caveat in the land and mortgage register . Subsequently , the court stayed the proceedings pending the outcome of the above administrative proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the delivery of the FAC Governor ’s decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , the applicants requested that the proceedings be resumed in the part concerning the following plots : CARDINAL ) CARDINAL . DATE , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE ; CARDINAL ) nos . ORG and ORG ; CARDINAL ) no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a partial judgment in respect of the plots listed under CARDINAL ) nos . CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE and CARDINAL ) CARDINAL . CARDINAL and DATE . The judgment in this part became final . The proceedings in respect of plot no . DATE continued .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings in respect of plot no . DATE as it had decided , following the request of another party , to re - open the proceedings in respect of plots nos . CARDINAL and DATE . The proceedings were resumed on an unknown date .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment in the case . In respect of the disputed plot no . DATE the court partly allowed the ORG claim and decided on rectification of an entry in the land and mortgage register in respect of plot no . CARDINAL . The court dismissed the remainder of the claim ( plots nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , finding that that part of plot no . DATE had been sold by the applicants’ predecessor in title in DATE . It had been in the possession of certain individuals until DATE when it had been resold to ORG with a view to realising certain development plans . The judgment became final as no parties lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were entered in the land and mortgage register as the owners of plot no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sold the abovementioned plot to the present occupier ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an action for recovery of plot no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings pending the outcome of the proceedings for rectification of an entry in the land and mortgage register ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the court to resume the proceedings . The applicants submitted that the proceedings regarding the rectification of the entry in the land and mortgage register had been pending before ORG . However , they wished to have the proceedings resumed as the GPE Governor ’s decision of DATE had become final in respect of plot no . CARDINAL and their title to this plot had not been disputed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants’ request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants requested the court to resume the proceedings as the proceedings regarding the rectification of the entry in the land and mortgage register had ended on DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . On DATE the court resumed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings were discontinued , since the applicants had withdrawn their action .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings for compensation for the use of their property by ORG without valid legal title . They claimed compensation for the period from CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The right of perpetual use of plot no . DATE was granted by ORG to the “ PERSON - Kieleckiego SA ” and that company was designated as the present occupier ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment in the case . On DATE ORG upheld the firstinstance judgment . On DATE ORG quashed the second - instance judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing in the case . At the hearing the applicants partly withdrew their claim in respect of plots nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment partly in the applicants’ favour awarding them the amount of ORG CARDINAL for the period from DATE to DATE . In respect of plot no . DATE the court awarded the amount of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL and dismissed the defendant ’s claim that part of that plot had been sold by the applicants’ predecessor in DATE as it had failed to substantiate them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants sold plot no . CARDINAL to the present occupier of the property - the “ PERSON - Kieleckiego SA ” . On the basis of that agreement the applicants were awarded compensation for the use of the plot without title for the period from DATE to CARDINAL DATE . In respect of the period from DATE to DATE the parties decided that it would be subject to another agreement to be concluded in the future or civil proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a complaint with ORG under LAW of DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to trial within a reasonable time ( “ the GPE ” ) . The applicants claimed just satisfaction in the amount of ORG . They also requested the court to take action to expedite and resume the proceedings for recovery of the property ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the complaints of PERSON and PERSON Tarnowski as all CARDINAL applicants had paid MONEY by way of ORG fees . It held that this had been contrary to section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , which provided that each applicant was obliged to pay the amount of ORG CARDINAL in respect of their complaints .

CARDINAL . Having examined the complaint lodged by Mr PERSON , on DATE ORG found that the proceedings had been handled properly . The court concluded that the fact that the proceedings had been suspended from DATE had not amounted to “ unreasonable delay ” as defined by LAW . It found that a delay had occurred only between the date when the applicants submitted their request for the proceedings to be resumed to ORG on DATE and the date of the decision on this matter on DATE . The court granted Mr PERSON just satisfaction in the amount of ORG as he had requested . The court dismissed the request for the proceedings to be expedited .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , is set out in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINAL-V , and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII , and the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V.

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning LAW No . CARDINAL is set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-VI , and PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY , judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
